comment.text: Probable transcription factor involved in the stress response.
No growth on non-fermentable carbon sources like glycerol and lactate and sensitivity to calcofluor white.
Present with 396 molecules/cell in log phase SD medium.

property.value: F:RNA polymerase II transcription factor activity, sequence-specific DNA binding

citation.name: Science
citation.title: Global analysis of Cdk1 substrate phosphorylation sites provides insights into evolution.

reference.scope: PHOSPHORYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT SER-944; SER-969; SER-1070; SER-1095 AND SER-1098
IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS]

comment.text: Positive regulator of FPS1 glycerol channel required for the glycerol efflux. As a component of the RNA polymerase II holoenzyme, is required for SSN8 destruction in response to oxidative stress but not heat shock. Required for cell survival in response to heat shock independent of SSN8.
Component of the RNA polymerase II holoenzyme. Interacts with RPO21 and SSN8.
Displays diffuse cytoplasmic localization, but very rapidly aggregates into punctate spots that appear near the cell surface in response to hypo-osmotic shock.
Phosphorylated in response to various stresses. stress-induced phosphorylation is partially dependent on HOG1.
